result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Not to enter bars, liquor stores or other establishments whose primary business is the sale of alcohol.

Provide DNA sample if not previously provided.  Pay DNA surcharge, costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Attend 5 self-help groups per week for the first year and provide writter verification of attendance to agent.  Do not association with persons using, possesing or selling controlled substances.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any other sentence
